[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Clone protection] Can the assert-private-keys-not-cloneable feature flag be disabled or bypassed at compile time, allowing attackers to clone InputSecret and violate the single-owner invariant critical for DKG security? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: generate()] [RNG state] If multiple validators call generate() with the same RNG state or seed, can this lead to secret collisions where multiple participants generate identical secrets, compromising threshold security? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: generate()] [Entropy exhaustion] Does generate() validate that the RNG has sufficient entropy before sampling, or can entropy exhaustion during DKG ceremonies cause predictable secrets to be generated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: generate()] [Side-channel on RNG] Can timing or power analysis attacks on the RNG operations within generate() leak information about the generated secret value to observers with physical access to validator hardware? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: zero()] [Degenerate secret] Can an attacker force or inject a zero-valued InputSecret into the DKG protocol, causing the dealt secret key to be trivially computable and breaking confidentiality guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: is_zero()] [Zero detection] Does the DKG protocol properly validate that input secrets are non-zero before using them in dealing, or can zero secrets bypass validation and compromise threshold cryptography? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: zero()] [Identity element abuse] Can the zero() constructor be misused to create neutral elements that, when aggregated with other secrets, effectively nullify contributions from honest validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: is_zero()] [Timing attack] Does is_zero() perform constant-time comparison, or can timing differences reveal whether a secret is zero, leaking sensitive information during DKG verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Trait: Zero] [Aggregation bypass] Can malicious validators exploit the Zero trait implementation to inject zero contributions during secret aggregation, effectively removing honest participants from the final shared secret? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: add_assign()] [Reference safety] Does add_assign() taking &InputSecret properly validate the reference lifetime, or can use-after-free bugs allow reading freed memory during secret aggregation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: add_assign()] [Associativity] Is the addition operation commutative and associative as required for distributed aggregation, or can different aggregation orders produce different final secrets causing validator disagreement?
